Katie: Jason’s younger sister. She is sixteen, she found out she had the power when she swallowed a girl who was her best friend, that didn’t have the power. Katie has the same body type as Melissa, except that she is 5ft 3ins, with medium length red hair.

Nikki: Jason’s Ex-girlfriend. She is 5ft 5in tall, with medium length blonde hair, with D-cup breasts, and semi-plump body type with nice thighs and wonderful round ass. She might come back into the story to try and finish the job that she started.

Rules must follow or your writing will be deleted, period.

1.) No other guys in the story, so no gay stuff. Girl on girl is fine.
2.) Only humans, because it is the right and only way.
3.) Age Limit for the girls and women is 16 to 34. So there can only be a mother character for a girl if the girl is 16 and the mother is 34. In that case, the mother can’t be any younger, and the girl can’t be any older.
4.) Jason’s power can fail and make him digestible.
5.) Bathroom scenes must be non-descript, so no description or mention of crap, poop, shit, pee.
6.) Spelling and grammar must be perfect, us a word processor program to check your work, not this site’s spell check, because I have found it to be wrong on occasion.
7.) To educate people here, this is how quotations are punctuated: Single quotation: “Yummy,” the redhead said. Double quotation: “You look delicious,” the sorority girl said, “Come here and let me taste you.” So, commas go inside a front quotation, and outside a back quotation.
8.) Chapters are to be written in the third person perspective::: (i.e) Jason couldn’t wait to be inside her.
9.) When you choose to write a new chapter, make a creative title, don’t use the one that is put in the blank, because it is the words that were in the choice you clicked on.
10.) New chapters must be made up of at least 6 well written sentences. Anything less really isn't worth an add. Do something that is creative with the added chapter, two simple lines about the main character getting swallowed just won't cut it. What you add has to at least look like a somewhat complete paragraph. It pretty much should look at least as long as the this rule that I have written here. It really doesn't take that long just to write this much.
